title: Acquisition Output
description: Output from the Acquisition Module documenting downloaded documents with cryptographic verification and validation status. The Acquisition Module downloads artefacts while preserving provenance, enforcing quotas, and ensuring integrity. Download requirements: MUST implement exponential-backoff retry logic, MUST honour HTTP/HTTPS rate-limit headers, SHOULD use HTTP Range requests with 16 MiB blocks for artefacts larger than 1 GiB. Validation: Every file MUST pass SHA-256 and SHA-512 hash verification, format/extension consistency check, minimum size threshold, and virus scan for external sources.

acquired_documents.description: Array of acquisition results, one entry per document attempt. Includes both successful and failed acquisitions to maintain a complete audit trail.

document_id.description: UUID of the document, matching the ID from discovery output. Used to correlate acquisition with discovery and downstream processing.

local_path.description: Local filesystem path or virtual URI where the acquired file is stored. SHOULD use 'adp://{bucket}/{key}' virtual URI scheme to abstract local vs. object storage locations.

file_hash_sha256.description: SHA-256 hash of the downloaded file in hexadecimal format (64 characters). MUST be computed from the complete file content. Used for integrity verification and deduplication.

file_hash_sha512.description: SHA-512 hash of the downloaded file in hexadecimal format (128 characters). MUST be computed from the complete file content. Provides additional cryptographic assurance beyond SHA-256.

file_size.description: Actual size of the downloaded file in bytes. Used to verify complete download and for storage accounting.

download_timestamp.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the download completed (successfully or otherwise). Used for tracking acquisition timing and SLA monitoring.

download_status.description: Status of the download operation. 'success': complete download. 'failed': download failed after all retries. 'partial': incomplete download (e.g., connection interrupted). 'abandoned': download skipped or cancelled (e.g., quota exceeded).

retry_count.description: Number of retry attempts made before reaching final download_status. Zero indicates success on first attempt. Used for monitoring source reliability and network issues.

validation_status.description: Result of post-download validation checks. 'passed': all validation checks succeeded (hash verification, format consistency, size threshold, virus scan). 'failed': one or more critical checks failed. 'warning': non-critical issues detected but file is usable.
